name: lib/cache/cacheBase.js
CacheBase
description:
Our base Cache implementation
Extend this class with new implementations to create different cache types (in-memory, database, file system etc.)

params.name: options.useMemoryCache
params.description:
Use an in-memory layer on top of this cache
 Avoid hitting databases too often
 Not useful if using any distributed setup where memory will be out-of-sync between processes

params.name: options.memoryCacheTimeout
params.description:
Timeout for in-memory cache values
 Default is null, which will use the incoming ttl values for each key

name: _get
description: Internal implementation of Get()

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

return.description: Returns the object in the cache, or undefined if not present

description: Internal implementation of Set()

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: object
params.description: Data to be set

name: _del
description: Internal operation to delete a key

params.name: key
params.description: Key name to delete

name: _getKeys
description: Internal implementation of getKeys()

name: get
description: Get a cached object

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: getFullObject
params.description: Get the full cache entry, including expiry time, even if expired

return.description: Returns the object in the cache, or undefined if not present

name: set
description: Set a key in our cache

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: ttl
params.description:
How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds
 Can be a number or a function that will return a number
 Default 1 hour

name: wrap
description:
A helper "wrap" function that will return a cached value if present
This will call the supplied function to fetch it if the value isn't present in the cache

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: fn
params.description: Fetch function that will be called if the cache entry is not present

params.name: ttl
params.description:
How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds
 Can be a number or a function that will return a number

name: getKeys
description: Get an array of all the cached keys matching the supplied prefix

name: lib/cache.js
createCacheInstance

Create a new Cache Instance.
This function should only be called once for the lifetime of the module.

name: getCache
description: Get the configured Cache implementation

name: lib/configBase.js
parseConfig
description: Combine given options with environment variables

params.name: options
params.description: Incoming options

name: ConfigBase
description:
Base Config Object
Supports classes with a single argument "options"
These will be sorted into a member called "this.config" containing all the same keys

Crucially, these can also be overriden through environment variables
For example, for a config option "timeout" for class Database, this could be overriden through either:
env.TPAPI_TIMEOUT (using a "global module name")

Classes can also add additional prefixes to the supported environment variables through:
new ClassInstance({configPrefixes: ['myCustomPrefix']});
Which would also allow env.MYCUSTOMPREFIX_TIMEOUT to be used

Note that a default value must be supplied for the environment variable to be processed
If the default value is a number, the environment variable will be cast to a number as well

name: constructor
description: A base class that can be configured through environment variables

params.name: options
params.description: Config for instantiating this object

name: lib/index.js
lib/parks/efteling/efteling.js
Efteling
description:
Efteling Park Object
Make sure all environment variables are set in an .env file which should be in the main location.
Not setting these variables will make the module exit early without returning data.

This class is here to fetch the POI data and to attach queue times data to it.
After the fetches this data is send to the end user and from there he could do whatever he wants to do.

Most park specific parameters are set already

name: constructor
description: Create a new Efteling Park object

name: getPOIS
description:
Get Efteling POI data
This data contains general ride names, descriptions etc.

name: buildRidePOI
description:
Build Efteling ride object
This data contains general ride names, descriptions etc.

return.description: All Efteling ride POIS without queuetimes

name: buildFairytalePOI
description:
Build Efteling fairytale object
This data contains general fairytale names, descriptions etc.

name: buildRestaurantPOI
description:
Build Efteling restaurant object
This data contains general restaurant names, descriptions etc.

name: buildShowPOI
description:
Build Efteling show object
This data contains general show names, descriptions etc.

name: buildMerchandisePOI
description:
Build Efteling merchandise object
This data contains general merchandise names, descriptions etc.

name: getQueue
description:
Get Efteling QueueTimes data
This data contains the queue data, we'll assign them to the earlier fetched pois

name: getOpHours
description:
Get Efteling Park Hours data
This data contains the hours data, used to display the operating hours of Efteling

name: lib/parks/entity.js
Entity
description:
A super-class that Parks/Resorts/etc. inherit from.
Handles general logic for objects that are a place/entity.

name: constructor
description: Construct a new Entity

name: log
description: Debug log

params.name: args
params.description: Message to debug log

name: getTimeNowMoment
description: Return the current time for this entity in its local timezone

name: getTimeNow
description: Return the current time for this entity in its local timezone

name: Name
description: Get entity's human-friendly name string

name: LangOptions
description: Get entity's human-friendly language string

name: LocationString
description: Get entity's human-friendly location string

name: Timezone
description: Get entity's human-friendly timezone string

name: SupportsWaitTimes
description: Get entity's human-friendly waittimes support string

name: SupportsOpeningTimes
description: Get entity's human-friendly openingtimes support string

name: SupportsRideSchedules
description: Get entity's human-friendly ride openingtimes support string

name: FastPass
description: Get entity's human-friendly fastpass support string

name: FastPassReturnTimes
description: Get entity's human-friendly FastPassReturnTimes support string

name: Now
description: Get entity's human-friendly moment now string

name: lib/parks/europapark/europapark.js
EuropaPark
description:
EuropaPark Park Object
Make sure all environment variables are set in an .env file which should be in the main location.
Not setting these variables will make the module exit early without returning data.

This class is here to fetch the POI data and to attach queue times data to it.
After the fetches this data is send to the end user and from there he could do whatever he wants to do.

This class contains some login and refresh functions, but NEVER call them if you don't need them.
Most park specific parameters are set already

name: constructor
description: Create a new EuropaPark Park object

name: loginEP
description:
Login to EuropaPark API
NEVER call this method without calling refresh() or getPOIS()!
Calling this method too fast can cause a perm block from the Macks

name: refreshEP
description:
Refresh your just obtained ep token
Tokens are 6 hrs valid, however there's no point in just calling this function without queues or sth else

name: getPOIS
description:
Get All POIS of EuropaPark
This data contains all the POIS in EuropaPark

name: getQueue
description:
Get All Queues of EuropaPark
This data contains all the Queues in EuropaPark, attached with pois above.

name: getOpHours
description:
Get All Operating Hours of EuropaPark
This data contains all the Operating Hours in EuropaPark, fetched with currentyear.

name: lib/parks/park.js
Park
description: Base Park Object

name: constructor
description: Create a new Park object

name: getWaitTime
description:
Get All Queues of a park
This data contains all the Queues in park

name: getCalendar
description:
Get All Calendar Data of a specific park
This data contains all the calendar data of a specific Park

name: getData
description:
Get All Data of a specific park
This data contains all park's data, which is fetched earlier

This class is here to fetch the POI data and to attach queue times data to it.
After the fetches this data is send to the end user and from there he could do whatever he wants to do.

Most park specific parameters are set already

description:
Get All POIS of Walibi Belgium
This data contains all the POIS in Walibi Belgium, limited to their fast-lane services

return.description: All Walibi Belgium POIS with queuetimes

name: getOpHours
description:
Get All Operating Hours of Walibi Belgium
This data contains all the Operating Hours in Walibi Belgium, fetched with currentyear.

This class is here to fetch the POI data and to attach queue times data to it.
After the fetches this data is send to the end user and from there he could do whatever he wants to do.

Most park specific parameters are set already

Get All POIS of Walibi Holland
This data contains all the POIS in Walibi Holland, limited to their fast-lane services

name: lib/reusePromises.js
activeFunctions
description:
Module that wraps re-using the same Promise multiple times.
This allows a function to be called multiple times before returning, but only return once.
Useful for latent network requests,
such as requesting a document from multiple sources, but only making one HTTP request.

name: findActiveFunctionIndex
description: Find the active function with these arguments

name: reusePromise
description: Reuse a function until it resolves

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to pass to the function

name: reusePromiseForever
description: Reuse a function, returning it's result forever

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to pass to the function

name: _reusePromise
description: Internal call to run a Promise once time (and optionally keep result forever)

content:
# Themeparks-API Themeparks API loosely based on existing examples, however I wanted to kill some time and then this came up. Don't expect anything too cool tho.
![Unit Test](https://github.com/alexvv13/tp-api/workflows/Unit%20Test/badge.svg) ![Documentation Build](https://github.com/alexvv13/tp-api/workflows/ESDoc/badge.svg) ![Node.js CI](https://github.com/alexvv13/tp-api/workflows/Node.js%20CI/badge.svg) [![Build Status](https://api.travis-ci.com/alexvv13/tp-api.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.com/alexvv13/tp-api)
![node-current](https://img.shields.io/node/v/@alexvv13/tpapi) [![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/%40alexvv13%2Ftpapi.svg)](https://badge.fury.io/js/%40alexvv13%2Ftpapi)
![Snyk Vulnerabilities for GitHub Repo](https://img.shields.io/snyk/vulnerabilities/github/alexvv13/tp-api.svg)
[API documentation](https://alexvv13.github.io/tp-api "API Documentation")
[NPM Package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alexvv13/tpapi "NPM Package")
## About This is a module which fetches queue times and operating hours, and returns it as JSON to the user, the data could be used for anything, a website, a discordjs bot, some personal stuff or whatever. Be aware it's not perfect, but it works. It's just being build to work and return data, not to be efficient anyway. ## Table of Contents [About](#about)
[Table of Contents](#table-of-contents)
[Install](#install)
[ENV](#env)
[Usage](#usage)
[ -Running the script](#running-the-script)
[ -Example output](#example-output)
[Changelog](#changelog)
[Parks available](#parks-available)
[Features of supported parks](#features-of-the-parks)
[Result objects](#result-objects)
[ -Ride waittimes](#ride-waittimes)
[ -Schedules](#schedules)
[Park object values](#park-object-values)
[Tasks](#tasks)
## Install npm install @alexvv13/tpapi --save ## ENV In the directory where you're using tpapi, create an .env file and fill in the fields, an example can be found in the Github Repo, or in the ${path}/node_modules/@alexvv13/tpapi/.env.example, or copy below's example and fill in the fields yourself ``` LANGUAGES= 'en' LANG_UPPER= 'EN' EFTELING_API_KEY= EFTELING_APP_VERSION= EFTELING_API_VERSION= EFTELING_API_PLATFORM= EFTELING_SEARCH_URL= EFTELING_WAITTIMES_URL= EFTELING_HIST_URL= EUROPAPARK_APIBASE= EUROPAPARK_LOGINSTRING= EUROPAPARK_LOGIN= EUROPAPARK_REFRESH= WALIBIHOLLAND_APIBASE= WALIBIHOLLAND_APIURL= WALIBIBELGIUM_APIBASE= WALIBIRA_APIBASE= ``` ## Usage ### Running the script Run index.js for all parks
NOTE: If you use commonjs, it's REQUIRED to use the .mjs extension INSTEAD of .js!
Or create an .js file for yourself and do the following:
```javascript // Import all parks here import tpapi from '@alexvv13/tpapi'; const park = new tpapi.parks.Efteling(); // Fetch POIS Example usage of Efteling park.getWaitTime().then((poiData) => { console.log(poiData); }); // You can also call getCalendar() or getData() ``` ### Example output (Shortened to keep it readable) ```javascript { "name": "Stoomcarrousel", "id": "Efteling_stoomcarrousel", "waitTime": "0", "state": "Closed", "active": "false", "location": { "area": "Marerijk", "latitude": "51.651211", "longitude": "5.048955" }, "meta": { "category": [ "youngest-ones", "whole-family" ], "label": null, "description": "

Would you like a horse, a carriage, a pig or another vehicle? Take your seat in the Stoomcarrousel steam carousell, which is more than 100 years old, and lit it spin you around! Duration: varies. Wheelchair access: via the exit from this attraction.

", "short_description": "The old-fashioned fairground feeling", "type": "attraction", "single_rider": "false", "fastPass": "false", "tags": [ "nophysicalhelp2", "redwhitezones", "placesallocated", "leavingearlynotpossible2", "transfernecessary", "100undersupervision", "indoorattraction", "assistancedogs" ] } }, { "name": "Vogel Rok", "id": "Efteling_vogelrok", "waitTime": "0", "state": "Closed", "active": "false", "location": { "area": "Reizenrijk", "latitude": "51.652187", "longitude": "5.052811" }, "meta": { "category": [ "thrillseekers" ], "label": null, "description": "

The Vogel Rok is an exiting indoor rollercoaster in the dark. The rollercoaster does not completely turn over, but does zoom through the dark at 40 mph. You must be at least 1.20 meter tall for this attraction. Duration: almost 2 minutes. Wheelchair access: via the usual entrance to this attraction until the bottom of the stairs. Call here. An employee will then come to meet you.

", "short_description": "Lightning in the dark", "type": "attraction", "single_rider": "false", "fastPass": "false", "tags": [ "nophysicalhelp2", "redwhitezones", "placesallocated", "leavingearlynotpossible2", "transfernecessary", "minimum120", "pregnantwomen", "injuries", "dizzy", "indoorattraction" ] } } ``` ## Changelog [View tp-api Changelog](CHANGELOG.md) ## Parks available **3** Parks Supported * Efteling (tpapi.parks.Efteling) * Europa-Park (tpapi.parks.EuropaPark) * Walibi Holland (tpapi.parks.WalibiHolland) * Walibi Belgium (tpapi.parks.WalibiBelgium) ## Features of the parks Park Name | Live Queues | Park Hours ------------ | ------------- | ---------- Efteling |:heavy_check_mark:|:heavy_check_mark: Europa-Park |:heavy_check_mark:|:heavy_multiplication_x: Walibi Holland |:heavy_check_mark:|:heavy_multiplication_x: Walibi Belgium |:heavy_check_mark:|:heavy_multiplication_x: ## Result Objects ### Ride WaitTimes [ { id: (string or number: uniquely identifying a ride), name: (string: ride name), waitTime: (number: current wait time in minutes), active: (bool: is the ride currently active?), location: (object: contains location data such as latlon latitude: (number: ride's latitude), longitude: (number: ride's longitude), meta: { (object: can contain various park-specific information about this ride - field may be null) // examples of potential meta fields single_rider: (boolean: does this ride have a single rider line?), type: (string: what is this poi?), fastPass: (boolean: does this ride have a fastPass line?), isVirtQueue: (boolean: is this entity a Virtual Queue?), area: (string: section of the park this ride is located within), tags: { (object: can contain various ride-specific tags, can be null and fields differ per park) }, restrictions: { (object: can contain various ride-specific restrictions(minHeight etc), can be null and fields differ per park) }, }, status: (string: will either be "Operating", "Closed", "Refurbishment", or "Down"), }, ... ] ### Schedules [ { date: (dateFormat timestamp: day this schedule applies), openingTime: (timeFormat timestamp: opening time for requested park - can be null if park is closed), closingTime: (timeFormat timestamp: closing time for requested park - can be null if park is closed), type: (string: "Operating" or "Closed"), special: [ (array of "special" times for this day, usually Disney Extra Magic Hours or similar at other parks - field may be null) openingTime: (timeFormat timestamp: opening time for requested park), closingTime: (timeFormat timestamp: closing time for requested park), type: (string: type of schedule eg. "Extra Magic Hours", but can be "Event" or "Special Ticketed Event" or other) ], }, ... ] ## Park Object values There are some values available on each park object that may be useful. | Variable | Description | | :-------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Name | Name of the park | | Timezone | The park's local timezone | | LocationString | This park's location as a [latitude, longitude] string | | SupportsWaitTimes | Does this park's API support ride wait times? | | SupportsOpeningTimes | Does this park's API support opening hours? | | SupportsRideSchedules | Does this park return schedules for rides? | | FastPass | Does this park have FastPass (or a FastPass-style service)? | | FastPassReturnTimes | Does this park tell you the FastPass return times? | | Now | Current date/time at this park (returned as a Moment object) | | LangOptions | What languages does this park support? || import tpapi from '@alexvv13/tpapi'; // construct our park objects and keep them in memory for fast access later const Parks = {}; for (const park in tpapi.parks) { Parks[park] = new tpapi.parks[park](); } // print each park's name, current location, and timezone for (const park in Parks) { console.log(`* ${Parks[park].Name} [${Parks[park].LocationString}]: (${Parks[park].Timezone})`); } Prints: * Efteling [51.65098350641645, 5.049916835374731]: (Europe/Amsterdam) * Europa-Park [48.266140769976715, 7.722050520358709]: (Europe/Berlin) * Walibi Belgium [50.7038852, 4.5960371]: (Europe/Brussels) * Walibi Holland [52.4390338, 5.7665651]: (Europe/Amsterdam) ## Tasks - [ ] Add more parks - [X] Multi language support - [ ] Multiple Queue entities support - [X] Completely purge file-system - [X] Merge shared tasks to one function - [X] Generate a better infrastructure
name: ./README.md
package.json
